intro: Cryptantha bridgesii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry habitats, such as grasslands and open woodlands. It has small, trifoliate leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Cryptantha bridgesii is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions of California.
